runs.comm: ah, welcome to T20! Kulasekara lands a shortish wide ball that Lumb aims a massive yahoo at and misses. Bell would have silkily cut that for four. Just saying.
ooh, edged but wide of slip! Lumb gets squared up, in a way Bell would not have, as a ball zips off the seam. Runs to third man to get England and Lumb away
Kulasekara aims fuller, finds some away swing and Kieswetter is reluctant to get forward. Ends up prodding late and it ghosts the edge
Kieswetter's response is to shuffle down the track without much menace. He leaves alone
nicely done from the batsman, hopping across his crease and whipping to leg
Lumb is more secure here, chopping a shortish ball to third man to end a quiet first over
short and wide to begin with and another big swipe from Lumb at fresh air
good grief. That is a serious hoik. Again at fresh air but you have to admire the, well, I'm not sure but good intent I suppose

well, you have to say that was coming. Lumb departs. Swinging across the line, the ball found a top edge that went high towards mid-off. Not a happy return for Lumb, still looks like Bell would have been a better option
Kieswetter pops this fuller ball off his toes to midwicket to bring KP on strike. These two won that World Twenty20 final against Australia, remember
Pietersen comes down across the ball slightly and slices towards point
back of a length from Lakmal but the line remains tight. Kieswetter whips off his hip to deep square
Kieswetter is late getting forward to Kulasekara, again. The forward poke comes off an inside edge to midwicket
ah wonderful shot. Pietersen skips down and outside off stump and easily clips, with a flick of the wrists, wide of mid-on for four
Sangakkara comes up to the stumps in response so Pietersen is more cautious, punching a drive straight to mid-off and hurtling down for the single
another unhappy return for an England opener. Kieswetter this time. Rushes down the wicket, swings hard without a hint of timing at it loops gently to mid-off. Good start from Sri Lanka!
Morgan is as flinty-eyed as ever. Never changes that expression. Defends to cover
Kulasekara ventures full and Morgan drives with a really hard swing of the bat. The angle across him, however, means he misses
Pietersen aims another leg-side flick from a foot outside off stump. This delivery is not as full so he only collects one for his effort
classy stuff from Morgan, showing the openers how it's done. Shuffles down the track and eases, slowly, his bat through the line. The ball just kept going up and up and cleared the rope by a long way
four this time! Similar shot not timed quite as well. It was close to Lakmal as the bowler jumped but Morgan's strong forearms seemed to muscle it past him
ooh, Morgan on the charge again but some late swing into him finds the pads
Lakmal a touch wide this time and Morgan cuts hard to third man, who runs around and tumbles well to field
Pietersen clips very firmly to straight midwicket. Morgan had advanced and if the throw had hit he would have gone by a few yards
another lovely shot from Morgan. So easy. It was a shin-high full toss admittedly, but Morgan drove sweetly straight past the bowler for four
oh dear! Missed run out chance! Morgan dropped a defence by his toes and saw big KP haring down at him, Morgan had no option but to run and if Sanga's throw had hit he would have gone
flipped casually towards midwicket
Morgan down the wicket again but a slower ball prevents him doing anything dramatic
good stuff from Kulasekara, holding it back of a length as Morgan advances, giving him no chance to get any leverage. Blocked back to the bowler
"oh he's!.. er" says Miller. I thought it was out as Morgan nibbled at a slower one outside off. Apparently there was no edge
starts on a length around off stump. Pietersen drives hard, but straight to mid-off
there's the attempted yorker but Malinga overeggs it a touch and Pietersen happily flips off his ankle to deep midwicket
the drive comes off the toe-end and trickles to mid-off. Malinga cooking up good pace already. Such a shame his body isn't up to Test cricket
slung full and fast wide of off stump. Morgan drives and misses
this is already an excellent over. Yorker length here and Morgan bunts to point
90.5mph and full, straight too. Morgan's drive is gentle and finds mid-off. Ends the Powerplay and Sri Lanka will be the happier of the two. Still plenty of batting to come for England though
Perera, the new bowler, seems much more enticing than Malinga. He starts short and wide and Pietersen crashes to deep point. Good shot for one
Morgan clips off his hip, without much power, to square leg
Pietersen charges down and seems to intimidate Perera who goes back of a length and wide in response. Pietersen stands tall and emphatically powers a drive wide of mid-off for four
inventive! Don't see this much. Pietersen down the wicket and strolls a long, long way outside off stump. Ends up flipping it over short fine leg, up on one knee, for four
Perera is lucky to get away with this, shin-high full toss outside off stump. Pietersen crunches a back-foot swish to deep cover
good end to the over from Perera, back of a length and a tight line. Morgan's leg-side clip goes straight to short fine leg
Randiv is the new bowler and starts by spearing a wide one across Pietersen from around the wicket
again Randiv is very wide and had Pietersen not got a toe-end on this it would have been called a wide as well
fired in straight this time and it's worked to the leg side
worked into space for a single
fired across the right hander again, quite wide of off but Pietersen misses his cut
real thwack off the bat. You could here the noise reverberate around the ground as Pietersen thrust a foot forward and flat-batted this very, very hard for six down to long-on
sharp fielding off his own bowling saves Randiv a single
slower ball from Lakmal, starts very high but loops down past Morgan at about waist high. Morgan seemed surprised and missed his cut
big swing back into Morgan here and he almost falls over trying to jab out a yorker. Good delivery
Pietersen jumped wide of leg to give himself room. Ended up overdoing it and couldn't reach his off-side drive
good delivery again from Lakmal, full and straight and Pietersen can only drive down the ground quietly
unlucky for the bowler. Shortish and Morgan's carve went off the top edge  finer than he expected to the third man boundary
dropped! Oh dear! Morgan flat-batted a full toss straight to Angelo Matthews on the long-on boundary who set himself nicely, but dropped the chance
good shot here, Morgan down the wicket and swishing to deep cover where some excellent sliding fielding saves the boundary
turned around the corner for one
the angle across Pietersen is causing the batsman a touch of bother and he can't get any power on a drive
Randiv pauses before delivering, Morgan waits, and drive down the ground when it eventually arrives
ooof, Pietersen really hacked hard at this to cover
chopped out to deep point
a low, dipping full-toss is heaved out to wide long-on, and there are ironic cheers from the packed crowd as Mathews stops it cleanly
another full-toss - this one quite high - is thrashed down to long-on. Ah, and that's called a no-ball for height by Nigel Llong. Rightfully so
a little too predictably, another full-toss is dished up and this time Morgan is waiting for it, swiping the ball high over the midwicket boundary
six more! Another high full toss and Morgan sends it arcing over the leg-side, baseball style. A real crowdkiller, and don't they love it!
this time he manages to land a delivery, and Morgan shovels the half-volley out into the deep
full and very wide indeed, KP throws everything at it and a thick outside edge flies down to third man, where Lakmal cuts it off
six more! Another full toss and it's savagely dealt with by Pietersen, who smites it handsomely straight back over the bowler's head. A massive 24 runs from the over
but it doesn't help! Not the loosener by any means from Malinga, but it's just the right length for Morgan to get underneath and crack down the ground for another boundary
much better length, right up to the bat, and Morgan can only dig it out to cover

finally, Sri Lanka get the breakthrough! Malinga slung down a short ball - perhaps surprising Morgan a little - and the pull shot flew out to deep square where Mahela Jayawardene sprinted to his right to hold it cleanly
full outside off, Pietersen steps down the pitch to drive to long-off
slower ball from Malinga, but Bopara appears to pick it and defends quietly towards point
Bopara is off the mark, nudging a very full delivery through square leg
punched into the covers
Bopara skips down the track and taps it back to the bowler
flicked to midwicket for a sharp single
KP moves a foot outside leg before Jayasuriya has even reached the crease, the canny old man fires one at his legs but the ball slips a little too far down the leg side
Bopara rotating the strike well here, again nudging to leg

a wicket for Sanath, and it's a big one! Again Pietersen had backed right to leg, but this time Jayasuriya speared a much quicker one right at middle stump. KP was looking to run it down to third man and simply missed the ball
fired at the pads from round the stumps, Patel misses the glance and there's no single to be had
leading edge! But it drops just short of a diving Kandamby at extra cover. Randiv staying round the wicket to the right-handers
driven down to long-off for one
full outside off and angling further, Patel drives to cover

direct-hit, and Patel has been run-out! He was looking to run the ball past point, but hit the fielder. Inexplicably, he wandered out of his crease and was slow to get back as the throw came in. Lazy dismissal ... and Samit is utterly disconsolate as he walks off

well, this could've been really tight as well! Wright tapped the ball to Jayawardene at point and set off, Bopara sprinted across and dived into the crease ... but the throw was a little wide and he's safe
nurdled wide of midwicket for a rather more sedate single to end the over
flicked to mid-on
Wright follows suit, helping himself to a single as Jayasuriya creaks across to field at mid-on
glanced out to deep midwicket for one more
Wright stays deep in the crease and picks up one through square leg
ah, there's an off-side delivery, but the drive is stopped by a diving point fielder
another full ball outside off, this time it's driven out to deep cover
full toss on middle, Bopara jumps out and heaves to wide long-on
held back a touch by Randiv, and Wright can't get it away
this one is quicker and Randiv finds some extra bounce outside off. Wright had committed himself to the cut, however, and though he hit it in the air the ball flew well over the point fielder's head
driven down to long-on for a single
again Bopara uses his feet, getting right to the pitch to drive down to long-on
Wright moves across to the off side but Randiv follows him with a quicker one, beating the outside edge of a flailing bat
Malinga finds the inside edge of a drive, the ball bouncing between batsman and wicket
full, fast and straight, but not quite the yorker and so Wright is able to get it down to long-off for one
again Malinga misses his length, and this time it's a low, dipping full-toss. Still at very good pace though, and Bopara can only nudge to long-on for one
Wright aims a good-looking drive out to deep cover
very full outside off once again, Bopara toe-ends a drive into the leg side, the bottom hand coming into the stroke
Malinga slips one under Wright's swishing bat, but the ball is aimed outside off so there's no damage to the stumps
well, Bopara is about two feet outside leg as Jayasuriya trundles to the crease, but steps across as the ball is bowled ... and misses the glance
slapped out into the deep on the off side, they push hard for a second run and get home safely
there's the boundary England needed! Bopara picks up a leg-stump half-volley and gets a good connection to beat the deep midwicket fielder
another wicket for Jayasuriya! He's defying age and infirmity here, darting one in at middle stump as, once again, Bopara gave himself acres of space moving to leg. Scratchy innings from him ...
Woakes is off the mark straight way, flicking out into the leg side
nudged to leg once again, long-on is quickly in to keep them to one
great start! The yorker is dead on target and Woakes does really well just to keep that out
straight and very full again, this time Woakes manages to get the ball down to long-off for one
hacked out to deep cover in trademark style by Wright
Lakmal misses his mark with the yorker, but the low, dipping full-toss hits the toe end of the bat and loops down the ground. Just the single
Wright aims down the ground, but he can't quite get the distance and Perera sets himself to take the catch at long-off
very full outside off, Woakes uses the width to squeeze the ball down to third man
Woakes walks across to the off side and attempts the paddle-scoop to fine leg but doesn't connect ... emotive and extended appeal from Malinga, but the umpire reckons there's some bat on that
Broad is deceived by a slower ball outside off, missing it completely, but Woakes calls him through for a quick single all the same ... Sangakkara's shy misses the stumps
surprise bouncer from Malinga, and it's a quick one. Woakes heaves wildly but doesn't get close to it. They steal another single
another slower ball, another miss, and another cheeky bye is taken!

yet another slower ball from Malinga, this one full outside off, and Woakes is into the shot much too soon. He was trying to swipe to long-on but got right under the ball, and Mathews held onto the swirling chance
and still Broad can't get bat on it! They attempt to sneak another bye but this time Sangakkara throws straight to Malinga, who sprints back and runs Broad out by a distance
